paper_abstract: We study the frequency of the positive integers n that are products of two primes of the same order of magnitude and such that the congruence (k)Pi(i=1) p(i)(fi(n)) equivalent to 1 (mod n) holds with some fixed nonzero polynomials f(1)(X),..., f(k)(X) is an element of Z[X], where p(i) denotes the ith prime. The question is motivated by collision finding in the so-called Very Smooth Hash function, introduced by Contini et al. (Lecture notes in computer science, vol. 4004. Springer, Berlin, pp 165-182, 2006).
paper_title: VSH and multiplicative modular relations between small primes with polynomial exponents
